name: tampion
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a cover made of wood, metal, canvas (= strong, rough cloth), or rubber that goes over the muzzle (= the end, where the bullets come out) of a gun or cannon when the gun is not being used: Tampions were sometimes put into the chambers of cannons, over the powder, when the chamber was not full. It had been raining heavily all morning, so we had not removed the tompions.
More examplesFewer examplesThe tampions are fastened round the muzzle of the guns with leather collars. The metal tampions remained in place over the cannons of the sunken ship.
